page.title: 08ECOLOGY. CONSERVATION
page.content: {COAL MINE.}Local people have been upset by the proposals of the National Coal Board to mine coal in the south of the block. They fear that mining 150 million tons over 50 years would spoil this peaceful area. Pithead buildings would appear in the middle of the green belt,the winding tower would be as high as a 20 storey block & the environment would be affected by noise & dirt.The dumping of mine spoil would change the area for ever.There is fear of subsidence & falling values of homes.In Eastern Grn.parents are concerned that there will be more heavy lorries passing through the area. {MILLISON'S WOOD,}in Nov 84, after failing to get permission to build,a landowning firm chopped down 40 silver birch trees.Local residents protested.Preservation order achieved after T.V.& press publicity.
